solution_line_template: Lilith had {num_dozens} dozen water bottles, and since a dozen has {bottles_per_dozen} water bottles, the total number of water bottles she had was {bottles_per_dozen} bottles/dozen * {num_dozens} dozen = <<{bottles_per_dozen}*{num_dozens}={total_bottles}>>{total_bottles} bottles

To buy her friend the birthday gift, Lilith originally had to sell her water bottles for a total of {total_bottles} bottles * ${original_price_per_bottle}/bottle = $<<{total_bottles}*{original_price_per_bottle}={original_total_needed}>>{original_total_needed}

When she reduced the price to ${reduced_price_per_bottle} to meet the regular price, the total amount of money she had from the sales was ${reduced_price_per_bottle}/bottle * {total_bottles} bottles = ${reduced_total}
To buy her friend the birthday gift, Lilith has to find ${original_total_needed} - ${reduced_total} = $<<{original_total_needed}-{reduced_total}={money_to_find}>>{money_to_find} more
